summary: All previously-fixed items remain correctly addressed, and the new iteration-3 additions (rollback time-box, perf targets, circuit breaker spec, migration naming, ops baseline release gate, and expanded cache tests) do not introduce any new truly-blocking problems.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Task 3.2 mixed CI-implementable code/DB work with untestable ops/infra deliverables (pgaudit/CloudWatch/cron/SLOs), making DoD unachievable
previous_issues_status.notes: Still cleanly separated: 3.2 is explicitly code+DB migration with CI-provable AC; 3.3 is ops/infra and now explicitly a production release gate (which is consistent with the original intent and does not block code merge).

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Partitioning plan was ambiguous/incorrectly described ("partition trigger inheritance"), risking runtime insert failures when partitions are missing
previous_issues_status.notes: Still fixed and strengthened: native RANGE partitioning + DEFAULT partition safety net + idempotent partition creation function + scheduled job + CI headroom gate. This removes the insert-failure outage mode.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: GovernedMutationService coupling requirement lacked explicit scope (tables/write paths), making it impossible to prove all governed writes route through the service
previous_issues_status.notes: Still fixed: explicit governed write-path inventory (credit_lots, credit_reservations, agent_reputation), explicit non-governed exclusions, and CI/integration criteria for routing and for direct updates failing.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Sprint 2 Task 2.2 depended on Sprint 3 FR-6 audit trail without a port/stub, creating a cross-sprint blocker
previous_issues_status.notes: Still fixed: AuditTrailPort + fail-closed stub in Sprint 2, real wiring deferred and explicitly covered later (3.2/4.2). No cross-sprint blocker reintroduced.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Integration tests did not cover several DB-enforced invariants required by Task 3.2 (RLS/privileges, triggers, uniqueness, skew, idempotency), risking unverified life-critical properties
previous_issues_status.notes: Still fixed: Sprint 4 Task 4.2 DB harness + enumerated 13 scenarios that cover privilege/RLS/trigger enforcement, cross-partition uniqueness, skew constraint, idempotency, and quarantine fail-closed behavior.
